concept.title: DTD: Coding requirements for element-domain modules
concept.shortdesc: The vocabulary modules that define element domains have an additional coding requirement. The entity declaration file must include a parameter entity for each element that the domain extends.

keywords.indexterm: naming conventionsDTDparameter entity for element domains

dd.p: The name of the parameter entity is the abbreviation for the domain, followed by a hyphen ("-"), and the name of the element that is extended.

example.p: For example, the name of the parameter entity for the highlight domain that extends the ph element is hi-d-ph.

dd.p: The value of the parameter entity is a list of the specialized elements that can occur in the same locations as the extended element. Each element is separated by the vertical line ( | ) symbol.

example.p: For example, the value of the hi-d-ph parameter entity is "b | u | i | line-through | overline | tt | sup | sub".
